      squares every element in ar
      static double[] trim(double[] ar, int start, int end)
      removes start samples from the beginning of the ar and end samples from the end of ar
      and returns the result as new double[] array
      static double[] upsample(double[] x, int n)
      upsamples the given array x by factor n
      the implementation uses no recursion to be faster
      Example: upsample(x, 10) will create an array of length x.length * 10
      static double[] upsample2(double[] x, int n)
      upsamples the given array x by factor n using recursion
      therefore being slower than upsample()
      static double[] windowedSpan(double[] ar, int win, boolean dropUneven)
      computes the span for ar in each window defined by win and returns new double array
      static double[] zeroRange(double[] ar, int s, int e)
      sets the elements of ar in specified range [s, e] to zero
      static double[] zscore(double[] x)
      normalization of vector x with zscore
